result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald W. Evans

defendant.name: Evans, Donald W.
defendant.address: 225 S Water St E # 211, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 9:11 AM 
Defendant Donald W. Evans in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Donald W. Evans.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess; 9:13am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference to be scheduled informally    (2) Status Conference on 12/15/22 at 2:30pm

[ma] Cas called at 9:24 AM 
Defendant Donald W. Evans in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Donald W. Evans.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Evans waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:26am 

NEXT:   Arraignment on 10/21/22 at 8:30am
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am. {CORRECTED - paper copy not distributed to SPD office. -AR 8/2}

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned plea hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  {*INCORRECT NOTICE, NOT DISTRIBUTED. -AR 8/2}

1:36 PM 
Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald W. Evans and Atty. De La Rosa appeared by video from the Jefferson County Jail.  SPD will appoint counsel. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge(*s) and maximum penalties are recited

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint 

The Court requires a $3500.00 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, including needles and syringes. 
--not to operate a motor vehicle without valid drivers license.

Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for Prelim Hrg. - 9/16/22 at 8:30am
recess 

NEXT:   
Prelim Hrg. - 9/16/22 at 8:30am
